author: ajsutton
content: If a validator client is running multiple validators that are both assigned as aggregator for the same committee in the same slot - is there any reason for it to produce two `AggregateAndProof` instances (which would both be the same but with different proof signatures) or should it just produce the one?  I don't believe there's any reward for aggregating so I'm inclined to only publish one of them.

author: paulhauner
content: That's a good point; the gossip network would try to supress the second `AggregateAndProof` since its `aggregate` has already been seen.

author: ajsutton
content: Goodo, that's some code I can delete then...
